summary: Mobile-responsive Maspar sales team portal (HTML/CSS/JS, CodePen-ready) with sales-team login (no public viewer) + secure Admin panel, English-only UI (no Hindi), corporate clean modern white/soft-shadow card UI with sidebar navigation, localStorage-based catalog/media management (PDF/image/video) with view-only protected viewing (best-effort no-download), and support for item metadata including Product Name, Label (terminology replaces Collection), Preview/Open, description, edit/replace file, delete/hide, and reordering; includes Admin-uploaded New Arrivals banner (1280x720).
architectural_notes: Pure HTML/CSS/JS only; CDN libraries allowed (e.g., PDF.js); must run directly on CodePen.
No server backend; persist catalogs/metadata via LocalStorage.
Content protection is best-effort (disable right-click/drag; no-download UX), not true DRM.
Remove bilingual (English/Hindi) label support and any language toggle; use English-only labels throughout.
Update brand/theme colors to Orange #FAA831 and a 70% grey dominant UI theme (replace prior orange #F15A22 usage).
User-side access now requires sales-team login (no public/no-login viewer).
UI copy requirement: replace the term “Collection” with “Label” everywhere in the app.
known_issues: User reports requested UI changes were not applied/visible; verify latest build reflects requested updates (especially theme colors).
New Arrivals banner is not showing on the home page (regression/bug to fix).
Build/deploy pipeline hit a configuration error ("Please notify the Caffeine team"); blocks applying latest changes until resolved.
Media Type viewer is not opening (user reports issue: "media type not opening"); investigate and fix.
User reports website data is not updating on another link/environment; investigate deployment/version sync or caching causing stale data across links.

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-responsive portal UI with a premium glassmorphism look using Maspar brand colors (Orange #F15A22, Grey #4A4A4A, White), including a header with an orange gradient, minimal layout, and smooth hover/lift + transition animations.

Implement a two-area navigation model: (1) a Public Viewer area that requires no login for sales executives, and (2) an Admin area protected by a simple credential check using username `admin` and password `maspar2026`.

Provide an Admin Upload section that allows adding catalog items (PDFs, videos, images) with an in-form preview, and saving all item metadata (title, bilingual labels, collection, media type, and the media source reference) into LocalStorage (no server persistence).
Display catalog content in the Public Viewer as collection-wise glass cards (e.g., Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, Cushions) and allow browsing by selecting a collection to see its items.
Implement search and filtering in the Public Viewer by collection and by label, supporting bilingual labels (English/Hindi) with a UI language toggle for labels.
Add modal popup viewers (with a clear close button) for each media type: PDF (render first page), video (in-page player), and image (zoom-only viewing).

Apply best-effort content protection behaviors in the Public Viewer and modal viewers by disabling right-click/context menu, drag-to-save on images, and obvious download affordances, while keeping the UI smooth and lightweight.
Use clear English user-facing UI text throughout the app (navigation, buttons, helper text), while still supporting bilingual (English/Hindi) item labels.

Provide a simple initial dataset (seed) stored to LocalStorage on first run (if empty) demonstrating at least one item in each of the collections Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, and Cushions, so the Public Viewer is not empty on first open.

Create a predefined label list based on the uploaded image and make it available to the frontend as a single source of truth. The label list must include: Colorart, Vintage, Hermosa, Rurban, Essentials, Eternal Treasure, Hues, Inhouse, Cotsmere, Little Maspar, Generic, Maspar.

Update the Admin Upload form so admins can select from the predefined labels instead of typing label text manually. Keep bilingual label support: selecting a predefined label should populate the English label field, and the Hindi label field must remain editable so admins can enter/override Hindi when needed.

Remove all Hindi-language label support and make the app English-only for catalog labels (including removing the EN/HI language toggle, removing Hindi label inputs in Admin, and updating search/filtering to use only English labels).
Add a "New Arrivals" banner feature: allow Admin to upload/set a banner image (exact size 1280x720 px) and display it prominently on the Public Viewer home page.
Add an Edit action in the Admin catalog table so Admin can update existing catalog items (title, label, collection, media type, and media source) and save changes to LocalStorage.

Implement label-driven organization updates in Admin: provide a way to assign each predefined label to a collection and add a "Category" field under labels (so Admin can set/edit a category for a label). Use this configuration as the single source of truth when creating/editing items.

Update the global theme tokens so the app primary brand color is Orange #FAA831 (replacing any remaining #F15A22) and the overall look is a grey-dominant ("70% grey") glassmorphism theme, while keeping orange as the accent for key UI emphasis (rings, active states, highlights).

Ensure the updated theme changes are actually reflected in the deployed build by removing/avoiding hardcoded color values in component classNames where they override theme tokens, and by relying on the CSS variables/theme tokens for all primary/secondary/accent styling.
Remove the Hindi language option from the Public Viewer by deleting the EN/HI language toggle UI and any related state/props so the Public Viewer is English-only.

Make catalog item labels English-only by removing Hindi label fields from Admin upload/edit flows and updating the catalog item type so items store a single English label value (no bilingual label object).
Remove localStorage-based label-language preference handling (including the language storage key and helper functions) since the app is English-only.
Add a safe client-side compatibility migration for existing localStorage catalog data so previously-saved bilingual labels are converted to English-only labels without breaking the app.
Update all user-facing UI text so there is no Hindi text and no language-related wording (e.g., remove the 'Language' label), and ensure remaining user-facing text stays in English.

Fix the "New Arrivals" banner on the Public Viewer home page so it reliably appears whenever a banner has been uploaded in Admin, including when the user uploads/removes the banner without a full page refresh.

Clarify and complete the unfinished user request "and remove the" by identifying any incomplete/stray UI text or UI element that is currently visible and removing it; if no such text exists in the UI, add a minimal confirmation prompt in the Admin area (or developer notes in code) indicating what specifically should be removed and where, so the requirement can be completed unambiguously.

Replace the Public Viewer collection filter control with a predefined-label filter: update the SearchAndFilters dropdown to list PREDEFINED_LABELS (plus an "All Labels" option) and update PublicViewer state + filtering logic to filter items by item.label (instead of item.collection).
Remove or hide the collection card selector UI in the Public Viewer so there is no collection-selection UI competing with the new predefined-label filter.

Update user-facing UI text that references collection filtering to use predefined-label wording (English only), including updating UI_TEXT keys used by the Public Viewer filter dropdown (e.g., change "Filter by Collection" / "All Collections" to "Filter by Predefined Label" / "All Labels").

Remove the three catalog items titled "Colorart Showcase", "Bedding Essentials", and "Cushion Designs" so they no longer appear as panels/cards in the catalog grid UI (as shown in the provided screenshot).

Update the default/seed catalog so it no longer seeds the removed items (specifically the seed entries currently titled "Colorart Showcase", "Bedding Essentials", and "Cushion Designs"), and add a safe client-side cleanup so previously-seeded instances of those items are removed from LocalStorage on load.

Remove the Blaize catalog/collection from the app so it no longer appears or can be created: (a) remove Blaize from the default collection list, (b) remove the seed item titled "Blaize Collection Catalog" so it is not seeded on first run, (c) add a safe client-side cleanup on load to remove any existing LocalStorage catalog items that are part of the Blaize catalog (at minimum: items with title "Blaize Collection Catalog" and/or collection id "blaize"), and (d) update the Admin Upload form so Blaize is not available as a selectable collection and is not used as the default collection value.

Add a "Label Thumbnail" capability for predefined labels by providing a thumbnail image for each label in PREDEFINED_LABELS and displaying it in the Public Viewer label UI: show the thumbnail next to each label option in the "Filter by Predefined Label" dropdown, and show the selected label’s thumbnail alongside the selected label value when a specific label (not "All Labels") is selected.

Display label thumbnails in the catalog grid by showing the corresponding predefined-label thumbnail next to (or directly above) the item.label text in each catalog item card when the label matches one of the predefined labels; if the label does not match a predefined label, show the existing label text without a thumbnail.
Add the user-uploaded logo image (uploaded file name: "cash counter  logo.png") to the Home page header so it is visible at the top of the Public Viewer without requiring any user interaction.

Ensure the header logo is responsive and does not break the existing header layout: keep the current title/subtitle readable, constrain the logo to an appropriate max height, and prevent the logo from being draggable/right-click-saved where feasible (consistent with existing best-effort content protection patterns).
Add the uploaded image file "Maspar  logo.png" as a static frontend asset and display it as the header logo on the Home page (Public Viewer) in place of the current logo image.

Ensure the Maspar header logo remains responsive and protected using the existing best-effort content-protection behaviors (not draggable, context-menu disabled) without breaking the header layout (title/subtitle remain readable on mobile and desktop).
Remove the Collection selection/control from the Admin Upload form so admins no longer see or interact with any Collection field on the Admin page.
Update the Admin Catalog table to remove the Collection column so the Admin page no longer shows collection values for existing catalog items.
Update any Admin UI text that references "Collection" so the Admin page remains clear and English-only after removing the Collection panel.
Remove the user-facing "Collection" field from the Admin upload form so Admin users cannot see or change any collection value when creating a catalog item.
Remove the "Collection" column from the Admin catalog table so existing items no longer display collection values on the Admin page.
Update Admin user-facing text so the Admin area contains no visible "Collection" wording after removing the Collection UI.

Fix the media viewer modal so selecting a catalog item in the Public Viewer reliably opens the correct viewer (Image/Video/PDF) and does not immediately close due to incorrect Dialog onOpenChange handling.

Add user-visible, English-only error handling inside the media viewer modal for unsupported media types and media load failures (invalid URL, blocked iframe/video, etc.), without breaking existing best-effort content protection behaviors.

Improve Admin Upload preview behavior so each Media Type provides an in-form preview that matches how it will open in the viewer (Image shows image preview, Video shows video preview, PDF shows an embedded first-page preview when possible), and add basic validation messaging when the Media Source URL is missing or invalid.

Investigate and fix the issue where selecting a catalog item does not open the correct media viewer (Image/Video/PDF) in the Public Viewer, and ensure the modal reliably opens and stays open when an item card is clicked.

Add a safe client-side compatibility cleanup/migration when loading catalog items from LocalStorage to prevent media viewers from failing due to invalid or legacy `mediaType` and/or missing `mediaSource` values (e.g., uppercase values like "PDF", unexpected strings, or empty URLs). Normalize known variants to supported values ('image' | 'video' | 'pdf') and handle unknown/invalid values gracefully.

Investigate and fix why catalog data changes made in the Admin area do not appear in the Public Viewer when the user opens the app in another tab/window of the same site (same origin), without requiring a hard refresh.

Add safe, explicit catalog-change synchronization similar to the existing banner synchronization: broadcast catalog updates on write and subscribe to updates so the UI refreshes when LocalStorage changes (including via the browser 'storage' event for other tabs).

Add clear English-only user-facing guidance in the Admin area explaining that catalog/banner data is stored in the browser (LocalStorage) and will not automatically sync between different website links/domains or different devices.
Add an Admin "Data Transfer" section that lets an admin export (download) all locally-stored portal data (catalog items + New Arrivals banner) as a single JSON file, using clear English UI text.

Add an Admin import flow that allows uploading a previously exported JSON file and restores the catalog + banner into LocalStorage, then refreshes the UI so the Public Viewer on the same link immediately shows the imported data without a hard refresh.

Update the Admin storage notice/help text to include a short, clear instruction that data will not sync across different links/domains/devices and that "Export/Import" is the supported way to move data to another sharing link.

Admin login (admin/maspar2026) with admin-only upload section and file preview
Public viewer tab for sales team (no login) to browse catalogs, videos, and images
Collection-wise organization and cards (e.g., Blaize, Colorart, Bedding, Cushions) with modal popup viewers
Protected media viewing: PDF first-page viewer (PDF.js), video no-download player, image zoom-only; disable right-click/drag
Persist uploaded content and metadata in LocalStorage (no server)
Mobile responsive layout optimized for field sales phone usage
Provide predefined label set and let Admin assign/select collections based on labels (label-driven collection organization)
Add “New Arrivals” section: Admin uploads a 1280x720 banner and it displays on the home page
Admin Actions section: add an Edit option to modify existing catalog items/metadata
Update labeling model: admin can assign labels↔collections mapping and add a category field under labels
Update seed/sample data and any existing stored catalog compatibility handling so the app continues to work after switching to English-only labels and introducing label category mapping.
Update UI theme to use orange (#FAA831) with a 70% grey overall theme across the portal

Audit and fix any UI elements that still visually render with the old orange theme or inconsistent greys, ensuring the updated orange + grey theme is applied consistently across the Header, Tabs navigation, Collection cards, Search/Filters panel, Item grid cards, and the Media viewer modal.
Add sales-team login for user-side access (replace prior no-login public viewer)

Admin catalog management enhancements: delete or hide items and reorder catalog display order
Update UI layout to corporate clean modern style: white background, soft-shadow cards, sidebar navigation (Dashboard, Labels, Catalogs, Media, Admin Settings)
Update UI button text: replace “Collection” button with “Predefined Label” (predefined labels selector)
Update navigation/UI: remove the current panel the user referenced and add a dedicated "Label" tab
Remove the following sections/items from the UI/content list: "Colorart Showcase", "Bedding Essentials", "Cushion Designs"
Remove the Blaize collection/catalog from the available catalog/collection list and UI views
Add a thumbnail image for each Label ("Label Thumbnail") and display it in the Labels UI
Add Maspar logo on the home page (portal landing/dashboard)
Remove the Collection panel/section from the Admin page ("madmin"), so it no longer appears in the admin UI
